page.title: 19Shop
page.content: The village shop and garage have been in the family for 18 years.Originally it was a small shop selling cycle and car spares and other odds and ends but when the local village shop near by closed down, this shop became the local store.It sells most things apart from spirits,beer and drapery. A business has operated on this site for 70 years.The shop has regular customers for bread milk and groceries not only from Stenness but also from the edges of adjoining parishes. Since the shop and garage lie on the main road from Kirkwall to Stromness, the shop and particularly the garage pick up a lot of passing trade.The garage is a vehicle testing centre. School transport is also provided by the garage.The shop opens at 7.30am and closes at 9.00pm.On Sunday the opening hours are 9.30am-9.00pm. Long hours!
